answers.answer: I third that! I look forward to visiting here every day. It's amazing how attached we can become to a bunch of names in a virtual "room" but it is very much a form of support and advice. Everyone needs to pat themselves on the back!

I was thinking about that too...i really dont have anyone to ask these questions too, although im not pregnant right now, if i were to become pregnant, my mother in law wouldn't be an option because she doesn't think we should have any more kids, and my mother isn't talking to me because she doesn't like my husband (she thinks he is controlling and mean, i don't agree he lets me do what i want and doesn't ever tell me what to do), i am not talking to my sister because she said my husband and i are horrible parents (she has no kids and doesn't even live in the same state) so you ladies are the only ones i talk to about this kind of stuff (even if it is advice on harnesses ) but i mentioned this to my husband last night (about asking you guys about the harnesses) he looked at me like i was totally crazy!  lol...but i explained to him i would rather have advice from people that have been through the experiences that i will be going through someday and such and he thought it was a great idea to have others to talk to!  I love this site and can't get enough of it, although i don't post too much, i will only respond if it is a situation that i have been through myself because i don't want to give advice that is unfit to a situation!
Hello....I haven't talked to you in about a week.   How are you??   No more scares?
I agree, the ladies on here were a godsend when I had my two mc and have been so encouraging this pregnancy.
I totally agree with you.  It is amazing how much strangers can touch your life.  I don't know what I would have done without the support of you girls.  I thank you all so much!!   xxxxxx

Hi (: Actually, yesterday they thought I might have preeclampsia! I had high blood pressure and swelling so they tested my urine for protein and that (Thank GOD) came out negative. I have to go weekly now though. We started our childbirth classes last night and it was really great. Ben is a first time Dad (If you don't count how he is already more of a father to my girls!) so he bonded with the guys there who were also first time Dads. They also had to wear 30 lb empathy bellies. It was great!! How are you doing?

Geesh...I'm glad your test came out neg!I'm doing good.  I went in on Tues because the baby has dropped and I have had pressure to the point that it hurts to walk.  I don't know whats normal and whats not since this is my first.  They said its just the way I"m carrying him.  I'm meausuring 2 weeks ahead too so I'm hoping that my dates were off and I'll be having him early August.  (wishful thinking)I wanted to do the classes.  My husband isn't a first time daddy but I am.  He didn't want to do them and I don't want to make him go.  They sound like fun though!!Not too long before Brody and Ayden make their apearences!!!

Crazy that your baby has dropped already. They were saying in class last night that first time babies drop weeks before labor usually but second or more babies don't usually drop until just shortly before delivery. I didn't know that and to me it would seem the other way around, but what do I know! I bet you can breathe better now! I can't wait to meet my little man! Just think...not too long and we'll be posting about our babies and post partum ;)

You know you have been the main one out there to help me get through my pregnancy. So I want to thank you for that. You are a wonderful person and you always have words of encouragement to hand out, even when you are strugling also. My little Olivia is a week old today!

Oh my gosh!!!  I was thinking about you today and was going to post a "Has anyone heard from Sarubers??" post.  I'm so happy you posted!  I'm so excited your Olivia is finally here!  For both of your sakes. :)  How are you feeling?  How is Olivia doing?  How are your other kids and DH doing?  Are the itchies now gone, and are you able to get some sleep in between feedings? So many questions!  I'm so glad you posted!  You have been a touchstone for me, and I'm so glad you are back!

question: I just wanted to tell all of you on this forum who have been there for me, and with this latest scare with GBS, all of you are simply wonderful.  I was trying to explain to DH last night how much all of you on this forum have helped me cope throughout the last 9 months (he has, too, but in a totally different way, you know?)  Through spotting in early pg, through pain, through grief over the loss of a loved one, through the GD testing, through GBS...  It's really amazing how people I've never physically met before can become my support system.  I don't know what to say but thank you.  I wish there was a more eloquent way for me to say it, and maybe there is, but I'm truly indebted to your kindness and support and hope that I've offered the same to some of you out there, too.  After delivery, I hope we will all be back.
title: A note of Thanks
